== Brunswick Stew ==
:brunswick:stew:NC:

Adapted from:

- [[https://www.melissassouthernstylekitchen.com/brunswick-stew-recipe/|Melissa's Southern Style Kitchen]]
- [[https://grandmarecipes.com/authentic-brunswick-stew-recipe/#google_vignette|Grandma Recipes]]
- [[https://insanelygoodrecipes.com/brunswick-stew/|InsanelyGood]]
- [[https://tasteofsouthern.com/brunswick-stew/|Taste of Southern]]
- [[https://wellfedbaker.com/classic-brunswick-stew/|Well Fed Baker]]
- [[https://www.allrecipes.com/meet-brunswick-stew-11820246|allrecipes]]
- [[https://www.lanascooking.com/brunswick-stew/|Lana's Cooking]]
- [[https://www.smalltownwoman.com/brunswick-stew/|Small Town Woman]]
- [[https://www.southernliving.com/brunswick-stew-8767274|Southern Living]]
- [[https://www.thekitchn.com/best-brunswick-stew-recipe-23690550|the kitchn]]

*Ingredients*:

- 4 Tb butter
- 1 c yellow onion, diced
- 1 tsp fennel seed
- 4 cloves garlic, minced
- 3 c chicken broth
- 2 c baby lima beans
- 2 c corn
- 28 oz crushed tomatoes
- 14 oz diced tomatoes
- 2 c cubed potatoes
- 1-2 c BBQ sauce, mix of mustard and vinegar based
- 3 Tb Worcestershire sauce
- 1 tsp seasoned salt
- 1 tsp mignonette pepper
- 2–3 sprigs thyme
- 2 bay leaves
- ½ tsp cayenne pepper
- ½ allspice
- 1 tsp smoked paprika
- ½ lb pulled pork
- ½ lb smoked brisket
- 1 lb shredded chicken
- ¼ c tomato paste for thickening

*Directions*:

1. Melt butter over medium heat.
2. Sauté onion until soft, ~7 minutes.
3. Sauté garlic and fennel seeds for 1 minute, stirring constantly.
4. Deglaze pan with broth and transfer to 6 qt slow cooker.
5. Add broth, meat, vegetables and seasonings. Stir well.
6. Adjust thickness with stock or tomato paste, as needed.
7. Add brown sugar (1–2 Tb) or vinegar (1–2 tsp), as needed, to balance BBQ
   sauce.
8. Cook on low for 6 hours or on high for 3-4 hours.
